content: This page explains how to create a Task in a Confluence page e.g. a WG's minutes. But then the page waves its hands and shows a populated list of such things (under a heading Action Items). How does on make this magic happen? Does the help page cruelly omit the words "For instance, you could use this feature to manually create a list of Action Items"?

When you edit, simply select the checkbox from the menu, then @mention the assignee
Multiple such tasks can be formatted as an Action Item list - there is nothing special to it, just a heading and list of tasks...
I just did it on the minutes page, to confirm that it works, feel free to delete it.

Aha! So the checkbox can be added automatically, but contrary to what that help page looks like, there is NOT a feature that automatically grabs all the tasks from the page and lists them (like a Table of Contents).

I object. :-) But that's what I needed to know - thanks!

Fur future pilgrims: it's also possible to initiate a Task by typing [ then ] (which apparently triggers a macro to enter the necessaries), or by using this button in the toolbar that's cleverly disguised as a checkbox:
image.png
